metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7837 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in BlueZ 5.41 and earlier allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code via the parse_line function used in some userland utilities.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7837` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bluetooth - 4.101-0ubuntu13.3
bluez - 4.101-0ubuntu13.3
bluez-alsa - 4.101-0ubuntu13.3
bluez-audio - 4.101-0ubuntu13.3
bluez-compat - 4.101-0ubuntu13.3
bluez-cups - 4.101-0ubuntu13.3
bluez-gstreamer - 4.101-0ubuntu13.3
bluez-pcmcia-support - 4.101-0ubuntu13.3
bluez-utils - 4.101-0ubuntu13.3
libbluetooth3 - 4.101-0ubuntu13.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bluez package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.101-0ubuntu13.3').
